p: Yb(AlH 4) 2 was reported by Kost et al. in 1978 [ 239]. The compound has a hydrogen content of 3.43 wt.%. It was produced in cold ether by the metathesis reaction between LiH, Al, and a metal halide. Kost et al. reported that Yb(AlH 4) 2 is a yellow powder that decomposes at 70 Â°C. The decomposition products of Yb(AlH 4) 2 are the hydrides of Al and Yb [ 239]. The YbH 2 is metastable at room temperature [ 262].
